info.description: Amazon GuardDuty is a continuous security monitoring service that analyzes and processes the following data sources: VPC Flow Logs, AWS CloudTrail event logs, and DNS logs. It uses threat intelligence feeds, such as lists of malicious IPs and domains, and machine learning to identify unexpected and potentially unauthorized and malicious activity within your AWS environment. This can include issues like escalations of privileges, uses of exposed credentials, or communication with malicious IPs, URLs, or domains. For example, GuardDuty can detect compromised EC2 instances serving malware or mining bitcoin. It also monitors AWS account access behavior for signs of compromise, such as unauthorized infrastructure deployments, like instances deployed in a region that has never been used, or unusual API calls, like a password policy change to reduce password strength. GuardDuty informs you of the status of your AWS environment by producing security findings that you can view in the GuardDuty console or through Amazon CloudWatch events. For more information, see Amazon GuardDuty User Guide.
info.title: Amazon GuardDuty

get.description: Lists detectorIds of all the existing Amazon GuardDuty detector resources.

parameters.description: You can use this parameter to indicate the maximum number of items you want in the response. The default value is 50. The maximum value is 50.
parameters.name: maxResults

parameters.description: You can use this parameter when paginating results. Set the value of this parameter to null on your first call to the list action. For subsequent calls to the action fill nextToken in the request with the value of NextToken from the previous response to continue listing data.
parameters.name: nextToken

parameters.description: Pagination limit
parameters.name: MaxResults

parameters.description: Pagination token
parameters.name: NextToken

post.description: Creates a single Amazon GuardDuty detector. A detector is a resource that represents the GuardDuty service. To start using GuardDuty, you must create a detector in each region that you enable the service. You can have only one detector per account per region.

clientToken.description: The idempotency token for the create request.

enable.description: A boolean value that specifies whether the detector is to be enabled.

findingPublishingFrequency.description: A enum value that specifies how frequently customer got Finding updates published.

tags.description: The tags to be added to a new detector resource.

delete.description: Deletes a Amazon GuardDuty detector specified by the detector ID.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector that you want to delete.
parameters.name: detectorId

get.description: Retrieves an Amazon GuardDuty detector specified by the detectorId.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector that you want to get.
parameters.name: detectorId

post.description: Updates an Amazon GuardDuty detector specified by the detectorId.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector that you want to update.
parameters.name: detectorId

enable.description: Updated boolean value for the detector that specifies whether the detector is enabled.

findingPublishingFrequency.description: A enum value that specifies how frequently customer got Finding updates published.

post.description: Creates a filter using the specified finding criteria.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector of the GuardDuty account for which you want to create a filter.
parameters.name: detectorId

action.description: Specifies the action that is to be applied to the findings that match the filter.

clientToken.description: The idempotency token for the create request.

rank.description: Specifies the position of the filter in the list of current filters. Also specifies the order in which this filter is applied to the findings.

tags.description: The tags to be added to a new filter resource.

delete.description: Deletes the filter specified by the filter name.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector the filter is associated with.
parameters.name: detectorId

parameters.description: The name of the filter you want to delete.
parameters.name: filterName

get.description: Returns the details of the filter specified by the filter name.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector the filter is associated with.
parameters.name: detectorId

parameters.description: The name of the filter you want to get.
parameters.name: filterName

post.description: Updates the filter specified by the filter name.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector that specifies the GuardDuty service where you want to update a filter.
parameters.name: detectorId

parameters.description: The name of the filter.
parameters.name: filterName

action.description: Specifies the action that is to be applied to the findings that match the filter.

rank.description: Specifies the position of the filter in the list of current filters. Also specifies the order in which this filter is applied to the findings.

post.description: Lists Amazon GuardDuty findings for the specified detector ID.

parameters.description: The ID of the detector that specifies the GuardDuty service whose findings you want to list.
parameters.name: detectorId

parameters.description: Pagination limit
parameters.name: MaxResults

parameters.description: Pagination token
parameters.name: NextToken

maxResults.description: You can use this parameter to indicate the maximum number of items you want in the response. The default value is 50. The maximum value is 50.

nextToken.description: You can use this parameter when paginating results. Set the value of this parameter to null on your first call to the list action. For subsequent calls to the action fill nextToken in the request with the value of NextToken from the previous response to continue listing data.

sortCriteria.description: Contains information about the criteria for sorting.

post.description:
Archives GuardDuty findings specified by the list of finding IDs.

Only the master account can archive findings. Member accounts do not have permission to archive findings from their accounts.

parameters.description: The ID of the detector that specifies the GuardDuty service whose findings you want to archive.
parameters.name: detectorId

findingIds.description: IDs of the findings that you want to archive.

post.description: Generates example findings of types specified by the list of finding types. If 'NULL' is specified for findingTypes, the API generates example findings of all supported finding types.

parameters.description: The ID of the detector to create sample findings for.
parameters.name: detectorId

findingTypes.description: Types of sample findings that you want to generate.

post.description: Marks specified Amazon GuardDuty findings as useful or not useful.

parameters.description: The ID of the detector that specifies the GuardDuty service whose findings you want to mark as useful or not useful.
parameters.name: detectorId

comments.description: Additional feedback about the GuardDuty findings.

findingIds.description: IDs of the findings that you want to mark as useful or not useful.

post.description: Describes Amazon GuardDuty findings specified by finding IDs.

parameters.description: The ID of the detector that specifies the GuardDuty service whose findings you want to retrieve.
parameters.name: detectorId

findingIds.description: IDs of the findings that you want to retrieve.

sortCriteria.description: Contains information about the criteria for sorting.

post.description: Lists Amazon GuardDuty findings' statistics for the specified detector ID.

parameters.description: The ID of the detector that specifies the GuardDuty service whose findings' statistics you want to retrieve.
parameters.name: detectorId

findingStatisticTypes.description: Types of finding statistics to retrieve.

post.description: Unarchives Amazon GuardDuty findings specified by the list of finding IDs.

parameters.description: The ID of the detector that specifies the GuardDuty service whose findings you want to unarchive.
parameters.name: detectorId

findingIds.description: IDs of the findings that you want to unarchive.

post.description: Creates a new IPSet - a list of trusted IP addresses that have been whitelisted for secure communication with AWS infrastructure and applications.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector of the GuardDuty account for which you want to create an IPSet.
parameters.name: detectorId

activate.description: A boolean value that indicates whether GuardDuty is to start using the uploaded IPSet.

clientToken.description: The idempotency token for the create request.

format.description: The format of the file that contains the IPSet.

location.description: The URI of the file that contains the IPSet. For example (https://s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/my-bucket/my-object-key)

name.description: The user friendly name to identify the IPSet. This name is displayed in all findings that are triggered by activity that involves IP addresses included in this IPSet.

tags.description: The tags to be added to a new IP set resource.

delete.description: Deletes the IPSet specified by the IPSet ID.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector the ipSet is associated with.
parameters.name: detectorId

parameters.description: The unique ID of the ipSet you want to delete.
parameters.name: ipSetId

get.description: Retrieves the IPSet specified by the IPSet ID.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector the ipSet is associated with.
parameters.name: detectorId

parameters.description: The unique ID of the ipSet you want to get.
parameters.name: ipSetId

post.description: Updates the IPSet specified by the IPSet ID.

parameters.description: The detectorID that specifies the GuardDuty service whose IPSet you want to update.
parameters.name: detectorId

parameters.description: The unique ID that specifies the IPSet that you want to update.
parameters.name: ipSetId

activate.description: The updated boolean value that specifies whether the IPSet is active or not.

location.description: The updated URI of the file that contains the IPSet. For example (https://s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/my-bucket/my-object-key).

name.description: The unique ID that specifies the IPSet that you want to update.

get.description: Provides the details for the GuardDuty master account associated with the current GuardDuty member account.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector of the GuardDuty member account.
parameters.name: detectorId

post.description: Accepts the invitation to be monitored by a master GuardDuty account.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector of the GuardDuty member account.
parameters.name: detectorId

invitationId.description: This value is used to validate the master account to the member account.

masterId.description: The account ID of the master GuardDuty account whose invitation you're accepting.

post.description: Disassociates the current GuardDuty member account from its master account.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector of the GuardDuty member account.
parameters.name: detectorId

get.description: Lists details about all member accounts for the current GuardDuty master account.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector the member is associated with.
parameters.name: detectorId

parameters.description: You can use this parameter to indicate the maximum number of items you want in the response. The default value is 50. The maximum value is 50.
parameters.name: maxResults

parameters.description: You can use this parameter when paginating results. Set the value of this parameter to null on your first call to the list action. For subsequent calls to the action fill nextToken in the request with the value of NextToken from the previous response to continue listing data.
parameters.name: nextToken

parameters.description: Specifies whether to only return associated members or to return all members (including members which haven't been invited yet or have been disassociated).
parameters.name: onlyAssociated

parameters.description: Pagination limit
parameters.name: MaxResults

parameters.description: Pagination token
parameters.name: NextToken

post.description: Creates member accounts of the current AWS account by specifying a list of AWS account IDs. The current AWS account can then invite these members to manage GuardDuty in their accounts.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector of the GuardDuty account with which you want to associate member accounts.
parameters.name: detectorId

accountDetails.description: A list of account ID and email address pairs of the accounts that you want to associate with the master GuardDuty account.

post.description: Deletes GuardDuty member accounts (to the current GuardDuty master account) specified by the account IDs.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector of the GuardDuty account whose members you want to delete.
parameters.name: detectorId

accountIds.description: A list of account IDs of the GuardDuty member accounts that you want to delete.

post.description: Disassociates GuardDuty member accounts (to the current GuardDuty master account) specified by the account IDs.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector of the GuardDuty account whose members you want to disassociate from master.
parameters.name: detectorId

accountIds.description: A list of account IDs of the GuardDuty member accounts that you want to disassociate from master.

post.description: Retrieves GuardDuty member accounts (to the current GuardDuty master account) specified by the account IDs.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector of the GuardDuty account whose members you want to retrieve.
parameters.name: detectorId

accountIds.description: A list of account IDs of the GuardDuty member accounts that you want to describe.

post.description: Invites other AWS accounts (created as members of the current AWS account by CreateMembers) to enable GuardDuty and allow the current AWS account to view and manage these accounts' GuardDuty findings on their behalf as the master account.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector of the GuardDuty account with which you want to invite members.
parameters.name: detectorId

accountIds.description: A list of account IDs of the accounts that you want to invite to GuardDuty as members.

disableEmailNotification.description: A boolean value that specifies whether you want to disable email notification to the accounts that you’re inviting to GuardDuty as members.

message.description: The invitation message that you want to send to the accounts that you’re inviting to GuardDuty as members.

post.description: Re-enables GuardDuty to monitor findings of the member accounts specified by the account IDs. A master GuardDuty account can run this command after disabling GuardDuty from monitoring these members' findings by running StopMonitoringMembers.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector of the GuardDuty account whom you want to re-enable to monitor members' findings.
parameters.name: detectorId

accountIds.description: A list of account IDs of the GuardDuty member accounts whose findings you want the master account to monitor.

post.description: Disables GuardDuty from monitoring findings of the member accounts specified by the account IDs. After running this command, a master GuardDuty account can run StartMonitoringMembers to re-enable GuardDuty to monitor these members’ findings.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector of the GuardDuty account that you want to stop from monitor members' findings.
parameters.name: detectorId

accountIds.description: A list of account IDs of the GuardDuty member accounts whose findings you want the master account to stop monitoring.

post.description: Create a new ThreatIntelSet. ThreatIntelSets consist of known malicious IP addresses. GuardDuty generates findings based on ThreatIntelSets.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector of the GuardDuty account for which you want to create a threatIntelSet.
parameters.name: detectorId

activate.description: A boolean value that indicates whether GuardDuty is to start using the uploaded ThreatIntelSet.

clientToken.description: The idempotency token for the create request.

format.description: The format of the file that contains the ThreatIntelSet.

location.description: The URI of the file that contains the ThreatIntelSet. For example (https://s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/my-bucket/my-object-key).

name.description: A user-friendly ThreatIntelSet name that is displayed in all finding generated by activity that involves IP addresses included in this ThreatIntelSet.

tags.description: The tags to be added to a new Threat List resource.

delete.description: Deletes ThreatIntelSet specified by the ThreatIntelSet ID.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector the threatIntelSet is associated with.
parameters.name: detectorId

parameters.description: The unique ID of the threatIntelSet you want to delete.
parameters.name: threatIntelSetId

get.description: Retrieves the ThreatIntelSet that is specified by the ThreatIntelSet ID.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the detector the threatIntelSet is associated with.
parameters.name: detectorId

parameters.description: The unique ID of the threatIntelSet you want to get.
parameters.name: threatIntelSetId

post.description: Updates the ThreatIntelSet specified by ThreatIntelSet ID.

parameters.description: The detectorID that specifies the GuardDuty service whose ThreatIntelSet you want to update.
parameters.name: detectorId

parameters.description: The unique ID that specifies the ThreatIntelSet that you want to update.
parameters.name: threatIntelSetId

activate.description: The updated boolean value that specifies whether the ThreateIntelSet is active or not.

location.description: The updated URI of the file that contains the ThreateIntelSet. For example (https://s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/my-bucket/my-object-key)

name.description: The unique ID that specifies the ThreatIntelSet that you want to update.

get.description: Returns the count of all GuardDuty membership invitations that were sent to the current member account except the currently accepted invitation.

post.description: Declines invitations sent to the current member account by AWS account specified by their account IDs.

accountIds.description: A list of account IDs of the AWS accounts that sent invitations to the current member account that you want to decline invitations from.

post.description: Deletes invitations sent to the current member account by AWS accounts specified by their account IDs.

accountIds.description: A list of account IDs of the AWS accounts that sent invitations to the current member account that you want to delete invitations from.

get.description: Lists tags for a resource. Tagging is currently supported for detectors, finding filters, IP sets, and Threat Intel sets, with a limit of 50 tags per resource. When invoked, this operation returns all assigned tags for a given resource..

parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the given GuardDuty resource
parameters.name: resourceArn

post.description: Adds tags to a resource.

parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the given GuardDuty resource
parameters.name: resourceArn

tags.description: The tags to be added to a resource.

parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the given GuardDuty resource
parameters.name: resourceArn

parameters.description: The tag keys to remove from a resource.
parameters.name: tagKeys

The Amazon GuardDuty endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)

AccessKeyDetails.description: Contains information about the access keys.

AwsApiCallAction.description: Contains information about the API operation.

City.description: Contains information about the city associated with the IP address.

DnsRequestAction.description: Contains information about the DNS request.

Evidence.description: Contains information about the reason that the finding was generated.

IamInstanceProfile.description: Contains information about the instance profile.

InstanceDetails.description: Contains information about the details of an instance.

LocalPortDetails.description: Contains information about the port for the local connection.

Master.description: Contains information about the Master account and invitation.

Member.description: Continas information about the member account

NetworkConnectionAction.description: Contains information about the network connection.

NetworkInterface.description: Contains information about the network interface.

PortProbeAction.description: Contains information about the port probe.

PortProbeDetail.description: Contains information about the port probe details.

PrivateIpAddressDetails.description: Contains information about the private IP address.

ProductCode.description: Contains information about the product code.

RemoteIpDetails.description: Continas information about the remote IP address.

RemotePortDetails.description: Contains information about the remote port.

SecurityGroup.description: Contains information about the security group.

SortCriteria.description: Contains information about the criteria for sorting.

Tag.description: Contains information about the tag associated with the resource.

ThreatIntelligenceDetail.description: An instance of a threat intelligence detail that constitutes evidence for the finding.

UnprocessedAccount.description: Contains information about the accounts that were not processed.
